column4: i think lmsensors though, is strictly a "monitor".. i don't think it will turn on/off fans
that I'm not at all sure of :)
there's a default BIOS setting in my BIOS config for "Fan Always On" - *disabling* that doesn't change anything - is there something the natty installer would have inherited from that?

so "fans always on" in the BIOS, dosn't make them stay always on?... thats weird.. i don't think the Natty Installer would have "inherited" anything from that, but like I said, i've never had that issue.
what is your laptop model again
my fault - I"m not explaining my problem. my fans *are* always on. In Winders, they cycle on and off as needed. I'll live with the fan running for now if that's my best bet
ok.. so your fans are always on, but you're trying to figure out a way to shut them on/off, like in 'doze, correct?
ideally, yeah, I'd like 'sensors' to turn fans on/off as needed. ('sensors' or whatever else I may need)
thanks for fiddling with this for me :)
turns up a lot of hits on that machine and "fans not working" but not much else.
yeah, I've been through the forums and googling for a week or so. hehe.
yeah, unfortunately thats the extent of my knowledge on this, which sadly, is very limited.
i dunno.. i would just set the fans to be "always on" if it were me...
no problem; I'd rather have them always on than not running at all :)
I can live with it for now.
thatas your prob.. :) xchat-gnome compared to regular xchat, is like a porche to a pinto
haha, I get that, but I'm more or less happy with *-gnome :)
yeah, its a simple client, but really doesn't have a lot of options (as you see)
